page.title: 15LORD'S LOT WOOD
page.content: Lord's lot wood is near Capernwray.The trees are mainly evergreen.They have dark green,thin,waxy needles and sometimes pinecones.There are Spruce and pinetrees here and dotted around are deciduous trees such as Hazel and Oak.Fire precautions have been taken.There are "witch's brooms" which are bundles of sticks to stamp out any fire that may begin.Also there are gaps that run up through the trees to prevent the fire spreading.Fire is always{great risk}in a great wood like Lord's Lot.There are picnic facilites for the public.There are benches and tables and a parking area off the main road.Deer are often seen here along with rabbits and occasionally foxes.The Gamekeeper's Tower is a ruined tower on the hill looking down on Capernwray.
